situation.title: Crossing the green border
situation.meta_description: Rules and recommendations for crossing the green border.

content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

You can find the rules for crossing borders to neighboring countries on the traveler's map (only in Czech), where the conditions for entering a particular country are also clearly written (eg quarantine, test, registration).

Before the trip, also check the conditions for returning to the Czech Republic from abroad on the website of the Ministry of the Interior.

Controls on the borders with the Czech Republic were introduced by Austria on 9 January 2021, and apart from a few exceptions, quarantine is mandatory after crossing the border.

From 14 February 2021, controls are introduced at the border with Germany. In most cases, only German citizens and their families, persons with a residence permit in Germany, transportation workers, healthcare workers, and passengers for urgent humanitarian reasons (eg death in the family, birth of a child, serious health issues) can travel to Germany.

Passage through Germany is possible only for humanitarian reasons.

You can view summary information for travelers to the Federal Republic of Germany in Czech and English and other languages.

If you have any further questions regarding traveling abroad, contact the info line of the Ministry of the Foreign Affairs: +420 222 264 222 (available on MON-FRI from 08:00 - 16:00. Additionally, outside of this time frame there will be basic information regarding traveling to other countries available).
